code_repairing_2:
There are several things you can do to optimize your C++ code to improve its speed:

• Use vectorization: Try to use vector instructions like those available on modern processors. These allow you to perform the same operation on multiple elements of a data structure simultaneously, which can lead to better performance.

• Use appropriate data structures: Choose data structures that are well-suited to the type of data you are working with and that will allow you to optimize the way you access and modify it.

1. ***bool***: Sirve para representar valores lógicos como verdadero o falso.
2. ***char***: Sirve para representar un único carácter.
3. ***string***: Sirve para representar una secuencia de caracteres.
